p: According to Zhang et al., who reported a 15-year follow-up of 80 SARS patients, out of whom 71 completed the follow-up, pulmonary lesions diminish only during the first year after infection ( p < 0.001). At the beginning of the study 9.4% (1.57%–17.23%), after one year 3.2% ± 4.78% and after 15 years 4.60% ± 6.37% of patients had pulmonary lesions visible on CT scans [ 30]. As reported by Zhang et al. pulmonary interstitial damage caused by SARS mostly recovered [ 30].
